Dear Ms. Reid:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
March 9 & 10, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the MSA and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of
human services, the equivalent state or Canadian
provincial agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides, that the
person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The
documentation shall be completed not more than
30 days prior to the start of employment and every
12 months thereafter.
One of 26 new employees did not have verification that she had
not been determined to be a perpetrator of abuse or neglect in
Pennsylvania prior to being hired. This is a social service
supervisor. A clearance from Pennsylvania has been
requested. The social service worker is in training and will not
have any contact with children until the agency receives the
clearance.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance
within 30 days of the completion of the probationary period
or within 180 days, whichever is less, and a written
evaluation of the employee’s performance annually
thereafter.
Two of 26 new employees did not have a performance
evaluation within a probationary period.
4

R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(a) – (j)
For three of six residents, this documentation was not in the
record at the time of admission.
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(1) The social service worker shall complete, sign, and
date an updated treatment plan for each resident at
least once every 90-calendar days following the
initial treatment plan.
One of 11 UTPs was completed 23 days late.
2.) The facility is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance will all DDHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered much of the same consultation that was given in 2019:
The DHHS ITP and UTP templates should not be reformatted or altered by adding
charts or spread sheets.
Dates of signatures should be handwritten on signature pages.
Summarize the positive and overall behaviors of the child as well as those behavioral
trends/situations that rose to the level of an unusual incident. Incident reports should
not be transcribed and listed in the treatment plans.
There is no need to repeat the treatment/service provisions of the program in more
than one area of the report.
The progress toward goal achievement section on treatment plans only relates to the
time frame identified on the report.
5

Contacts should not be copied and pasted from Outlook or the agency’s own software
system into the social work contacts section of reports. Each contact should include
the date, type of contact (face-to-face, phone, email), parties involved with official
title/agency and the reason for contact.
Individual, group and/or occupational therapy sessions should not be listed in the
social work contacts section of reports. Therapeutic services is a provision of the
overall treatment program. Therapy case notes should be maintained separately and
be available upon request.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Methodist Children’s Home submitted five corrective action plans resulting from DCWL
special investigations. Four CAP’s were submitted and implemented related to the staff
not following the agency’s policies and procedures. The following policies were
reviewed, discussed and monitored with the staff: dispensing medication, child
supervision, staff in resident bedrooms, child discipline and mandated reporting.
Identified staff received disciplinary action for failing to adhere to agency policies. One
violation was established for failing to update a treatment plan with regard to visitation.
A corrective action plan was implemented that included updating visitation rosters; the
visitation policy was also reviewed with both direct care and clinical staff.
V. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
rules and statutes. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
